description: From earlier dishevely, from Old French deschevelé (modern French déchevelé and échevelé), from des- (“dis-”), + chevel (“hair”) (modern French cheveu).

adjectives.description: dishevelled (comparative more dishevelled, superlative most dishevelled)

entries.meaning: (of a person) With the hair uncombed.
examples: Synonyms: messy, scraggly, tousled, unkempt, untidy

entries.meaning: (by extension) Disorderly or untidy in appearance.
simple past tense and past participle of dishevel
